comment: A mild scotch that’s very fruit forward and a short finish. Enjoyable but not gonna be high on my list

This was actually the 12 year single malt

Colour - gold, amber, rich look
Nose - fruity, fresh, medicines
1st - rising heat, soft, light finish, citrus notes after a few minutes
2nd - more heat, shorter finish
3rd - flavours improved, more spices
Caramel, toffee tiny bit of smoke
A light taste, unique to my palate
Least favorite so far. Sweet and flat. Possibly others will taste better.
Three times destilled. Bourbon barrel. Mild smell and taste. Flavours of coconut and light fruits.
I actually had the Valich, which means it as cask strength. It ws really harsh and barely palettable.
Not bad at all for the price
Not the best bottle of scotch but it's nice just to pour when with a group of people. Not a bad price either. A cube or drop of ice mellows the fire.
Ok for a cheap bottle. Easy to drink for novice. Light golden hue, vanilla nose, citrusy vanilla sweet taste with short but smooth finish.
I'd do 2.5 stars if I could
Light add little ice. Watered down quick
Strong first smell, light taste. Not much body or lingering flavor, but smooth and easy to drink.  Lacking good flavor
Love this light, easy single malt. Good for introducing new people to scotch!
*Nose: really light peat, smoke, wood. Tough to grasp smells *Taste: light peat, spice, smoke *Finish: spice, flowers, sweetness
This isn't bad, it's overall pretty mild. Good for having around.
Light, fruity, not much follow through

Triple distilled, good heat, a pleasant linger, and is an excellent $40 bottle of Scotch

Nice smooth and mellow, sweeter & light, but still complex
A good change of pace
My first foray in to whisky so started with this as a recommendation from a friend. It a has a good burn to it but a more subtle aftertaste, which, as a novice, I liked.
Not NEARLY as good as the three wood, this one was a bit of a disappointment. Fruity, smooth, sweet (vanilla-y,) but there's really not much to it. It left me wanting, not satisfied.
Perfect for the begginer Scotch drinker. Typical Lowland lady, smooth as can be.
This is way better than the 2.9 average it's showing now. I definitely picked up on vanilla and honey notes. Definitely a smooth glass. Try it!

Nose: vanilla and coconut (as expected),peach, bit of hazelnut. Taste: sweet, pear, bit of white chocolate. Aftertaste: bittersweet, warm but short. Overall: nice easy-drinker single malt. Nothing outstanding, but pays for the price.
Vanilla, cream and toffee upfront with a drop of cough medicine. Perfumy, light and holding a lasting fruity, pleasant aftertaste.
Similar to Three Wood, but very dissimilar in finish. Sweet. Not bad.
Not much on its own - I have to agree with what others have said before. However, goes well with Dry where the bourbon notes come to the fore.
Oily and herbal and not really my kind of whiskey...
Very smooth. Almost too light. Sipped of my wife's after a pretty good dose of water - wish I tried it before that.
Funky rubbery chemical notes overpower everything. Looking to give this one away - perhaps to someone who likes cocktails.
Much more my taste profile than the American oak
Grass and flowers.  Required a lot of water to sip.  Not a fan of Lowland whisky.
Reminds me of grandpa Ken's garage

no age statement. 
43%
nose: sweet, bourbon, vanilla
palate: fruit, cream, sugar, peach
finish: med short, clean and floral
Creamy/smooth. Not harsh. Drinkable, but seemed to lack a bit of body.
